title: 232 - Starbucks Doesn't Sell Coffee: This Is The Secret to Unbelievable Growth
description:
Most artists have a feast or famine, tumultuous rollercoaster sort of creative career path. It's nearly impossible to thrive in these sorts of extreme conditions.

Building a consistently thriving business while navigating such enormous peaks and such treacherous valleys is a completely unattainable achievement.

In this episode we explore the secret ingredient to getting consistent results, sales and opportunities in your creative career.

We explore how to, on a scientific tactical level, deliver real potent value for your audience and why that changes everything!!!

SHOW NOTES
LES MCKEOWN - PREDICTABLE SUCCESS
https://predictablesuccess.com/

TYCHO
https://tychomusic.com/

HOW I BUILT THIS WITH HOWARD SHULZ
https://www.npr.org/2017/09/28/551874532/live-episode-starbucks-howard-schultz

FRANK CHIMERO - SUGGESTIONS FOR SPEAKERS
https://frankchimero.com/blog/2011/suggestions-for-speakers/

CREATIVE PEP TALK WORKLIST (WORK+PLAYLIST)
https://open.spotify.com/user/andyjpizza/playlist/3z2UfWxbNob3ra1ZdXZ6sX?si=MiihgL07RhuN23mEv6kHCQ

Dan Harmon's Writing Circle
https://gointothestory.blcklst.com/dan-harmon-the-heros-journey-and-the-circle-theory-of-story-b64bb77d6976

Oliver Jeffers
https://www.oliverjeffers.com/

CREDITS

Support Creative Pep Talk on Patreon: www.patreon.com/creativepeptalk

Thanks to Yoni Wolf and the band WHY? for our theme music.

Thanks to Alex Sugg for our soundtrack!
www.alexsugg.com

Mastering by Chris Graham Mastering
Check out Chris' Six Figure Home Studio Podcast
https://www.thesixfigurehomestudio.com/podcast/

author: andy@andy-j-miller.com (Andy J. Miller)
